page.title: 10I REMEMBER, I REMEMBER
page.content: LAST WEEK LOUISE JOHNSONS GRANDFATHER CAME INTO SCHOOL TO TELL US WHAT LEEK WAS LIKE WHEN HE WAS YOUNG. MR.JOHNSON IS SEVENTY TWO YEARS OLD. HE TOLD US HOW THE TOWN ITSELF HAD CHANGED. THE MAIN CHANGE BEING THE BUILDING OF THE MONUMENT CLOCK WHICH STANDS AT THE BOTTOM OF DERBY STREET AND IS A FAMILIAR LANDMARK. THE MONUMENT WAS BUILT TO COMMEMORATE THE DEAD OF THE FIRT WORLD WAR. IT ALSO BEARS THE NAMES OF THE SOLDIERS WHO DIED IN THE SECOND WORLD WAR AND EVERY NOVEMBER A SERVICE OF REMEMBRANCE IS HELD AROUND THE MONUMENT. BEFORE THE MONUMENT WAS BUILT THE AREA WAS KNOWN AS SPARROW PARK AND A CATTLE MARKET WAS HELD THERE EVERY WEDNESDAY.
